intro: Doxomma augusta, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, golden-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and has slender, branching stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Doxomma augusta is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
